column5: I am bringing my 17' Lund to Canada for the 1st time and would to know what I need to have to comply with Canada's regulations.

Simply put your boat needs to comply with the regulations for the state it is registered in. As a precaution make sure you can provide proof of ownership if asked. It is also a good idea while towing your boat to have your drain plug removed. Some states require this. I'm not sure about Canada. Nonetheless, you don't want to accidentally introduce invasive species from one body of water to another.
I believe there is some added precaution about the trailer hitch up there. cannot recall. someone on here will let you know.

It is recommended that the safety chains have latches or devices to prevent accidental disconnect. I mouse my chain hooks with electrical tape to prevent them from coming off of the hitch....http://www.mto.gov.on.ca/english/saf.../trailer.shtml
That's a new one for me --- Never have had anyone check/mention that when we have been going into Canada.
